Argentina will pay more than three billion dollars to the IMF in surcharge fees between 2018 and 2023‚Äì enough to vaccinate every Argentine nine times against COVID-19.
Ukraine owes tens of millions of dollars to the IMF in these surcharge fees each month, and it will have paid half a billion dollars in surcharges by the end of next year.
The IMF imposes ‚Äúsurcharge fees‚Äù to countries that hold large loans or owe for a long time. These charges are above and beyond regular loan and interest payments.

7/ But also, because U.S. producers sell to whoever pays the best prices. They make decisions on price, not patriotism.
